questions.question: What is the main purpose of the Singleton design pattern?
questions.answer: To ensure that a class can only be instantiated once.

questions.question: How does the Prototype pattern differ from inheritance in object-oriented programming?
questions.answer: It avoids inheriting functionality from a class and instead delegates it from an existing object, creating a flat prototype chain.

questions.question: What is the primary function of a factory design pattern?
questions.answer: To instantiate objects using functions or methods instead of the new keyword.

questions.question: Which structural pattern in programming provides a simplified API to hide complex low-level details?
What is the core concept behind an Observer pattern?
questions.answer: A push-based system where objects subscribe to events broadcast by another object.
